Rana Zoe tried to get a coronavirus test multiple times but her pain was dismissed. 

This tragedy is all too common for Black folks across our nation. Despair will not have the last word. Together, we will get through this.

We shall overcome.

My heart is absolutely broken for Amber Isaac's family and loved ones. At just 26 years old, Amber passed away from complications after giving birth to her son.

We need to speak truth that this pandemic is highlighting deep racial disparities in our health care system. https://twitter.com/essayolumhense/status/1254958385520414721 QT @essayolumhense Three days after posting this, Amber Isaac, 26, died during delivery.

More money is going to small businesses.

Great work by @AchievaCU & @BankSanibel for helping their community. 

https://www.winknews.com/2020/04/24/two-lee-county-small-businesses-receive-ppp-loans/

The average approved loan across the country in 2nd round of #PPP will be well below the 1st round average of $206000 indication it is reaching smaller businesses, non-profits & 1099/gig economy workers. 

This is VERY good news https://twitter.com/senatorcollins/status/1255524553901649926 QT @SenatorCollins PPP UPDATE: More than 18,000 Maine small employers have been awarded a total of $2.3 billion. Since applications reopened on Monday, 1,548 Maine small employers—with an average estimated size of fewer than four employees—have been approved for an average loan of $39,000.

China’s main objective: become the global superpower militarily, economically, and geopolitically. Now the Treasury Department is frantically trying to figure out how to recoup hundreds of millions granted to big companies instead of small businesses. https://trib.al/26Ektpz

25% of US adults have a disability, and this crisis has exposed the pre-existing scarcity of medical treatment, equipment, and resources available to the disability community. It’s time for Congress to fight for our values & address these disparities head-on.

This virus doesn’t discriminate based on immigration status—and our response shouldn’t either. 

We need to make sure everyone gets the coronavirus aid and economic relief they deserve.
